title: 96/56/EC: Commission Decision of 13 December 1995 approving the programme for the monitoring of infectious haematopoietic necrosis for 1996 presented by Finland and fixing the level of the Community's financial contribution (Only the Finnish text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 13 December 1995 approving the programme for the monitoring of infectious haematopoietic necrosis for 1996 presented by Finland and fixing the level of the Community's financial contribution (Only the Finnish text is authentic) (96/56/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The programme for the monitoring of infectious haematopoietic necrosis presented by Finland is hereby approved for the period from 1 January to 31 December 1996.
Finland shall bring into force by 1 January 1996 the laws, regulations and administrative provisions for implementing the programme referred to in Article 1.

1. The financial participation by the Community shall be at the rate of 50 % of the costs incurred in Finland concerning expenses related to the programme referred to in Article 1 up to a maximum of ECU 145 000.
2. The financial contribution of the Community shall be granted subject to:
- forwarding a report to the Commission every three months on the progress of the programme and the costs incurred,
- forwarding a final report to the Commission on the technical execution of the programme accompanied by justifying evidence as to the costs incurred, by 1 June 1997 at the latest.
This Decision is addressed to the Republic of Finland.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 13 December 1995.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
Member of the Commission
